brief_description: Ex vivo infections of DCs DENV2 and DENV4
brief_title: Project 3 - Optimization experiments DCs DV2 and DV4 - CyTOF
condition_studied: Innate immune responses to dengue virus infection
description: Ex vivo infections of human monocyte derived DCs DENV2 and DENV4 analysis were performed to study the innate immune profile upon infection with those viruses using CyTOF and to elucidate the appropiated time points for future experiments.
hypothesis: DV2 and DV4 induce diifferent activation profiles in DCs
objectives: To study the expression of surface markers and intracellular cytokines after infection in DCs
official_title: Project 3 - Optimization experiments DCs DV2 and DV4 - CyTOF

arm.description: De-identified buffy coats were obtained from the New York Blood Center
arm.name: NYBC_1

personnel.organization: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

pubmed.title: High-dimensional CyTOF analysis of dengue virus-infected human DCs reveals distinct viral signatures.

program.contract_name: Dengue Human Immunology Project Consortium (DHIPC MSSM)
